intro: Centaurea langei subsp. langei, commonly known as the Lange's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its unique appearance and ecological niche make it a notable species in its native range.
